div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 186px; height: 1px; padding-top: 125px; margin-left: 794px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Device memory base (db)
(0 on Verisilicon testing FPGA)

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 231px; height: 1px; padding-top: 235px; margin-left: 368px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Reserved host DDR memory base (hb)(Depends on host CPU IO configuration)

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 158px; height: 1px; padding-top: 215px; margin-left: 615px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 292px; height: 1px; padding-top: 220px; margin-left: 5px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 220px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

ul.li: Reserve a continuous linear buffer with same size as device memory;
Every time allocate a buffer on device side, reserve a buffer with same size from the save offset as device buffer on the host reserved memory;

Should be < 0x8000_0000, since 0x8000_0000 will be added to host DDR address. DMA Address >= 0x8000_0000 will be identified as host DDR address, which corresponds to host bus address Address-0x8000_0000.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 20px; margin-left: 610px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;

box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 130px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

ul.li: virtual_address -> host bus address (A) ->device bus address (A-hb+db) -> MMU mapped address

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 288px; height: 1px; padding-top: 70px; margin-left: 762px;

div.div: When MMU is enabled, bus_address will be the MMU mapped address.

switch.text: When MMU is enabled, bus_address will be the MMU...
